lexUnit.name: embarrassment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being self-conscious and ill at ease

sentence.text: I was shaking with embarrassment that he could talk to me in this way at all , as if he knew me , as if he had the right to question me .
It is to their obvious embarrassment that they are again together .
I have seen him as Grimes many times and never without a sense of embarrassment that this finely sensitive singer should have been asked to adopt a vicious role alien to him .
His embarrassment about self-disclosure gives the impression , belied by his other books , that he knew nothing of the mystery that grace works by means of human weakness , not by side-stepping it .
Many solicitors never overcome their own embarrassment about the amount that they charge , though few go on to lower their fees .
` It 's inconceivable , I agree , " responded Howard , waving a well-manicured hand , his plump face pink with embarrassment at the directness of Newman .
Jenna 's face flushed with embarrassment at the way the girl watched in amused surprise .
Her meagre shilling donation was an embarrassment in this wealthy company , but she refused to think of it .
" What 's this , playing infant games still ? " he demanded , and was gratified to see the flush of embarrassment in Tristram 's cheek .
I could tell from the blank embarrassment in Tom 's expression that she had not acknowledged him .
If there is not quite an embarrassment of riches , there is enough to make the small investor blush at the choice .
On this occasion , satyāgraha involved imprisonment of thousands of Indians , much to the embarrassment of the Union Government of South Africa .
It was then that I decided to drop a note through Carla 's letterbox rather than cope with the embarrassment of a phone call .
The row over the Fayed brothers ' acquisition simmers on , thanks to the Bank of England 's embarrassment over Harrods Bank .
The extent of their embarrassment over their bonding was illustrated by the fact they 'd held it so privately .
It was only the second occasion ever in which bankers had been summoned and reflected both the high degree of public outrage and government embarrassment over the spate of recent financial scandals .
Such old people may have little embarrassment with each other about bodily functions , perhaps less than some husbands and wives because they were the stuff of taken-for-granted childhood .
He grinned unrepentantly , watching her deep blush of embarrassment with apparent fascination .
Nobody doubted him , or failed to recognise his temporary financial embarrassment .
By resorting to a money-lender it became more difficult to conceal their embarrassment -- than if they had merely run up bills with retailers .
The manager who seeks to increase the nurse 's embarrassment or difficulties is of little help .
Often she would say something foolish , immediately regret it , then , to cover her embarrassment , say something worse .
In a war fought against a racist regime in Nazi Germany , the existence of widespread discrimination against blacks in the USA was a considerable embarrassment .
` You 'll not be alone with him , Maggie , he 's got a sister , and in any case Mitch will be there , " Richie muttered , red with embarrassment .
Caswell shuffled in obvious embarrassment .
` She 's just dying of embarrassment . "
We finally realised that we could avoid even that embarrassment by giving ourselves breathing space .
They will always try to avoid any embarrassment , but will use their judgement on whether or not to make payment .
